Aseptically, with a forceps, take a sheet of sterile filter paper.
Place the sterile filter paper inside a Petri plate.
Take another Petri plate. Open the lid.
Take the bottle labeled as 95% ethanol. Pour some amount of ethanol into the Petri plate and then recap the bottle.
With a forceps, dip a U shaped glass rod into the alcohol in the Petri plate.
flame it to burn off the alcohol.
Remove the glass rod and flame it to burn off the alcohol.
Now, place the sterile U-shaped glass rod on the filter paper and pour enough sterile water (about 4 ml) on filter paper to completely moisten it.
Pour enough sterile water (about 4 ml) on filter paper to completely moisten it.
Open the box containing glass slides. With a forceps, take out a glass slide.
Dip the glass slides into the alcohol in the Petri plate.
flame it to burn off the alcohol.
Remove the glass slide and flame it to burn off the alcohol.
With forceps, place the sterile slide on the U-shaped rod.
Take a scalpel.
Gently flame it the scalpel sterilize and then allowed to cool for sometime.
Take Sabouraud's agar plate.
Open the lid.
With the sterile scalpel, cut a 5 mm square block of the medium from the plate.
Pick up the block of agar by inserting the scalpel.
Carefully transfer this block aseptically to the centre of the slide, close the lid.
Take an inoculation needle from the rack.
Heat it in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner till red hot and then allowed to cool for sometime.
Open the lid.
With the sterile needle, take a small amount of culture form the plate.
Close the lid.
Take the Petri plate containing agar block, open the lid.
Inoculate four sides of the agar square with mycelial fragments of the fungus to be examined.
Inoculate four sides of the agar square with mycelial fragments of the fungus to be examined.
Open the box containing coverslip.
With a forceps, take out a coverslip and then dip it into the alcohol.
flame it to burn off the alcohol.
Aseptically, place the sterile cover slip on the upper surface of the agar cube and incubate at room temperature for 48 hours.
After 48 hours, there will be growth of fungi on the coverslip through the edges.
notext
Open the box containing glass slides. With a forceps, take out a glass slide.
Take another glass slide with the forceps.
Keep the glass slide near the first slide.
Place a drop of lactophenol cotton blue stain on the first slide.
Place a drop of lactophenol cotton blue stain on the first slide.
Close the bottle after dropping.
Open the lid of the Petri plate with fungal culture.
Carefully remove the cover slip.
Invert the cover slip and place it on the surface of the second glass slide.
Take a cappilary tube.
Take 95% alcohol using cappilary tube.
Add 95% ethanol to the centre of the cover slip.

As soon as most of the alcohol has evaporated, take the cover slip from the glass slide using a forceps and place it with the growth side down, on the drop of lactophenol cotton blue stain on the slide. This slide is now ready for examination.
Examine the slide under microscope.
Examine the slide under microscope.
Result:- Aspergillus niger with conidiophores.
Result:- Stained conidia of Alternaria
Result:- Conidiophores of Penicillium sp.
